intro: Ixia caelestina, commonly known as the sky blue ixia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue-violet flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm and features strap-like, grassy leaves. Ixia caelestina thrives in well-drained soil and prefers full sun to partial shade. Its blooms are short-lived but attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
